title: dropbox and owncloud database file syncronization conflict.
body:
### expected behaviour
no syncronization on dropbox or owncloud when they aren't in use.

### actual behaviour
when both services are actively monitoring the same root folder they switch back and forth between uploading a ".csync_journal.db"

i'm running windows 7 sp1 x64 with owncloud client 1.2.0 and dropbox client v.1.6.16.  owncloud is monitoring my local dropbox folder which is located at d:/dropbox (we'll just call it %dropbox%).  both dropbox and owncloud are configured to actively monitor this directory and sync any changes.

the problem is that the hidden database file (.csync_journal.db and .csync_journal.db.ctmp) that owncloud places in the root directory of my %dropbox% folder are constantly being resynced by both programs.  it goes something like this, in a loop:

1. owncloud creates .csync_journal.db in %dropbox%, which is synced to my owncloud server.
2. dropbox recognizes the .csync_journal.db file and proceeds to sync it to the dropbox server.
3. once the dropbox upload is complete, owncloud rebuilds the .csync_journal.db in the temporary file .csync_journal.db.ctmp in the %dropbox% directory.
4. once the databse is rebuilt, .csync_journal.db.ctmp is moved to .csync_journal.db, which prompts dropbox to upload the "new" file.


sorry this is such a confusing issue, but there really isn't a better way to word it.  i'm happy to respond with the relevant logs/questions.
